review_title: A Great Organization to work for.
pros: Great working environment. Casual workspace. Overall nice colleagues. Competitive salary.
cons: i was one of two people in the IT department to do after hours on-call duties. It became a little overwhelming after a while, but i guess it was part of the job description.

review_title: All that glitters is not gold!
job_title: Clinical Education Specialist -RN in Los Angeles, CA
pros: It's a job. We all need to have one. If a new grad can survive here for one year. They will have a great nursing career anywhere!
cons: For profit = poor quality patient care. Lack of working computers for nurses and staff. Other vital equipment does not work and is not repaired well. Most elevators do not work. Huge staff turn over.

job_title: Patient Access Representative in Long Beach, CA
pros: great staff, friendly environment, great location
cons: No cons, this is a great place to work

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Los Angeles, CA
pros: It is a smaller hospital so you get to know all staff on a personal level and the people you work with quickly become your work family.
cons:
low paying job. Have poor retention of their employees due to not enough support from higher management. Not well organized and bad habits from nurses go uncorrected.
Is a revolving door for new grad nurses.

review_title: They over work you  case load extremely high poor management
pros: Reasonable  pay can be better for the amount of stress
cons: They over work you no work life balance  manager send you emails at 4 and 5 in the morning . Case load is high to cheap to hire more staff  high turn over rate

job_title: Registered Nurse in Los Angeles, CA
pros: A great learning experience to find your own rhythm
cons: Poor communication, lack of proper protocol, unprofessionalism

job_title: Wound Care Nurse in Culver City, CA
pros: pay is good, management is not too strict
cons: there is no parking for employees

pros: i learned a lot thanks to my boss. I enjoyed working with most of my coworkers.
cons:
The leadership is only focused on money.. Employees mean zero to them. 

It's definitely a who you know company.

IT is terrible. They buy up hospitals and have a patchwork of systems puzzled together that do work well together. Their is no business intelligence. Their leaders require manual reports emailed to them daily when a system should be able to achieve that goal.

They are top heavy on senior leaders. There is a VP, administrator, and Director for everything. 

The work life balance for management is unmanageable. 

Their are constant "fire drills." Meaning you are constantly being given last minute tasks that have a high priority with people screaming at each other. It is more the norm than it should be because the constant strategy changes and different leaders arguing over what they want.

They pay out large bouses to senior leaders and then turnaround and layoff employees because they arent making goal.

The main points are the leaders from Corporate are only worried about money. They will give you crap training, systems, computers, benefits that are very expensive or cheap but crap, and maybe a 2% raise if you're lucky each year.

review_title: Worst/Least Ethical hospital system - Culture of Blame/Arrogance BEWARE!!
pros: The only pros are the rank and file employees who work at the corporate office and the hospitals.  The senior leadership of this place are the opposite
cons: Culture of Blame and Arrogance.  Saving money trumps patient care, best practices, and good-quality equipment every time.  They are pound-wise and penny-foolish. Especially managers and directors beware, they chop heads every time they need a scapegoat.  They don't match 401(k), their pay is not competitive, their PTO is stingy, their health benefits stick as well.

job_title: Corporate Office in Mar Vista, CA
pros: This is a big company.  The office is nice and new. Lots of people. Parking isn't hard. Pay is ok.
cons: Company is chaotic. Whole place is disorganized. Lots of lazy people. Only a few doing the work. Bad work culture. Lack of motivation. Horrible management.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Culver City, CA
pros: Team, progression to improving practices and procedures, room for growth. A good company to get a breadth of experience.
It's a very family oriented place to work.
cons: The pay is not that great and no raises to per diem employees.

pros: Great team to work with. Decent salary.
cons: Constant fight against higher administration just to follow the law.

job_title: Finance Variance Analyst in Norwalk, CA
pros: No micromanagement as long as you get your work done.
